content.body: krosylight: how are push subscriptions scoped currently? An origin can in theory create infinite service workers. Would each of them be able to get a push subscription? Or is there some implementation-defined limit?
content.formatted_body: krosylight: how are push subscriptions scoped currently? An origin can in theory create infinite service workers. Would each of them be able to get a push subscription? Or is there some implementation-defined limit?

content.body: Speaking of which, anyone here familiar with whether there's anything remotely like file signatures for JSON? Using a rather unique key is the best I've come up with thus far.
